061
062/**
063 * A subclassable default {@link Loader} implementation that delegates
064 * its work to {@link Provider}s and an {@link #ambiguityHandler()
065 * AmbiguityHandler}.
066 *
067 * @param <T> the type of configured objects this {@link
068 * DefaultLoader} supplies
069 *
070 * @author <a href="https://about.me/lairdnelson"
071 * target="_parent">Laird Nelson</a>
072 *
073 * @see Loader
074 *
075 * @see Provider
076 */
077public class DefaultLoader<T> implements AutoCloseable, Loader<T> {
078
079
080  private static final ThreadLocal<Map<Path<? extends Type>, Deque<Provider>>> currentProviderStacks = ThreadLocal.withInitial(() -> new HashMap<>(7));
081
082
083  /*
084   * Instance fields.
085   */
086
087
088  // Package-private for testing only.
089  final ConcurrentMap<Path<? extends Type>, DefaultLoader<?>> loaderCache;
090
091  private final Path<? extends Type> absolutePath;
092
093  private final DefaultLoader<?> parent;
094
095  private final OptionalSupplier<? extends T> supplier;
096
097  private final Collection<Provider> providers;
098
099  private final AmbiguityHandler ambiguityHandler;
100
101
102  /*
103   * Constructors.
104   */
105
106
107  /**
108   * Creates a new {@link DefaultLoader}.
109   *
110   * @see org.microbean.loader.api.Loader#loader()
111   *
112   * @deprecated This constructor should be invoked by subclasses and
113   * {@link ServiceLoader java.util.ServiceLoader} instances only.
114   */
115  @Deprecated // intended for use by subclasses and java.util.ServiceLoader only
116  public DefaultLoader() {
117    this(new ConcurrentHashMap<Path<? extends Type>, DefaultLoader<?>>(),
118         null, // providers
119         null, // parent,
120         null, // absolutePath
121         null, // Supplier
122         null); // AmbiguityHandler
123  }
124
125  private DefaultLoader(final DefaultLoader<T> loader) {
126    this(loader.loaderCache,
127         loader.providers(),
128         loader.parent(),
129         loader.path(),
130         loader.supplier,
131         loader.ambiguityHandler());
132  }
133
134  private DefaultLoader(final DefaultLoader<T> loader, final AmbiguityHandler ambiguityHandler) {
135    this(loader.loaderCache,
136         loader.providers(),
137         loader.parent(),
138         loader.path(),
139         loader.supplier,
140         ambiguityHandler);
141  }
142
143  private DefaultLoader(final DefaultLoader<T> loader, final Collection<? extends Provider> providers) {
144    this(loader.loaderCache,
145         providers,
146         loader.parent(),
147         loader.path(),
148         loader.supplier,
149         loader.ambiguityHandler());
150  }
151
152  @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
153  private DefaultLoader(final ConcurrentMap<Path<? extends Type>, DefaultLoader<?>> loaderCache,
154                        final Collection<? extends Provider> providers,
155                        final DefaultLoader<?> parent, // if null, will end up being "this" if absolutePath is null or Path.root()
156                        final Path<? extends Type> absolutePath,
157                        final OptionalSupplier<? extends T> supplier, // if null, will end up being () -> this if absolutePath is null or Path.root()
158                        final AmbiguityHandler ambiguityHandler) {
159    super();
160    this.loaderCache = Objects.requireNonNull(loaderCache, "loaderCache");
161    if (parent == null) {
162      // Bootstrap case, i.e. the zero-argument constructor called us.
163      // Pay attention.
164      if (absolutePath == null || absolutePath.equals(Path.root())) {
165        final Path<? extends Type> rootPath = (Path<? extends Type>)Path.root();
166        this.absolutePath = rootPath;
167        this.parent = this; // NOTE
168        this.supplier = supplier == null ? FixedValueSupplier.of((T)this) : supplier;
169        this.providers = providers == null ? loadedProviders() : List.copyOf(providers);
170        this.loaderCache.put(rootPath, this); // NOTE
171        // While the following call is in effect, our
172        // final-but-as-yet-uninitialized ambiguityHandler field will
173        // be null.  Note that the ambiguityHandler() instance method
174        // accounts for this.
175        try {
176          this.ambiguityHandler = this.load(AmbiguityHandler.class).orElseGet(DefaultLoader::loadedAmbiguityHandler);
177        } finally {
178          this.loaderCache.remove(rootPath);
179        }
180      } else {
181        throw new IllegalArgumentException("!absolutePath.equals(Path.root()): " + absolutePath);
182      }
183    } else if (!absolutePath.absolute()) {
184      throw new IllegalArgumentException("!absolutePath.absolute(): " + absolutePath);
185    } else if (!parent.path().absolute()) {
186      throw new IllegalArgumentException("!parent.path().absolute(): " + parent.path());
187    } else {
188      this.absolutePath = absolutePath;
189      this.parent = parent;
190      this.supplier = Objects.requireNonNull(supplier, "supplier");
191      this.providers = List.copyOf(providers);
192      this.ambiguityHandler = Objects.requireNonNull(ambiguityHandler, "ambiguityHandler");
193    }
194  }
195
196
197  /*
198   * Instance methods.
199   */
200
201
202  /**
203   * Clears any caches used by this {@link DefaultLoader}.
204   *
205   * <p>This {@link DefaultLoader} remains valid to use.</p>
206   *
207   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
208   * threads.
209   *
210   * @idempotency This method is deterministic but not idempotent
211   * unless the caches are already cleared.
212   */
213  @Experimental
214  @Override // AutoCloseable
215  public final void close() {
216    this.loaderCache.clear();
217  }
218
219  /**
220   * Returns a {@link DefaultLoader} that {@linkplain #providers()
221   * uses} the additional {@link Provider}.
222   *
223   * @param provider the additional {@link Provider}; may be {@code
224   * null} in which case {@code this} will be returned
225   *
226   * @return a {@link DefaultLoader} that {@linkplain #providers()
227   * uses} the additional {@link Provider}
228   *
229   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
230   *
231   * @idempotency This method is not idempotent (it usually creates a
232   * new {@link DefaultLoader} to return) but is deterministic.
233   *
234   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
235   * threads.
236   */
237  public final DefaultLoader<T> plus(final Provider provider) {
238    return provider == null ? this : new DefaultLoader<>(this, add(this.providers, provider));
239  }
240
241  /**
242   * Returns a {@link DefaultLoader} that {@linkplain #providers()
243   * uses} the additional {@link Provider}s.
244   *
245   * @param providers the additional {@link Provider}s; may be {@code
246   * null} or {@linkplain Collection#isEmpty() empty} in which case
247   * {@code this} will be returned
248   *
249   * @return a {@link DefaultLoader} that {@linkplain #providers()
250   * uses} the additional {@link Provider}s
251   *
252   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
253   *
254   * @idempotency This method is not idempotent (it usually creates a
255   * new {@link DefaultLoader} to return) but is deterministic.
256   *
257   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
258   * threads.
259   */
260  public final DefaultLoader<T> plus(final Collection<? extends Provider> providers) {
261    return providers == null || providers.isEmpty() ? this : new DefaultLoader<>(this, add(this.providers, providers));
262  }
263
264  /**
265   * Returns a {@link DefaultLoader} that {@linkplain #providers()
266   * uses} only the supplied {@link Provider}.
267   *
268   * @param provider the {@link Provider}; may be {@code null} in
269   * which case {@link Provider}s will be loaded using the {@link
270   * ServiceLoader} class
271   *
272   * @return a {@link DefaultLoader} that {@linkplain #providers()
273   * uses} only the supplied {@link Provider}
274   *
275   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
276   *
277   * @idempotency This method is not idempotent (it usually creates a
278   * new {@link DefaultLoader} to return) but is deterministic.
279   *
280   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
281   * threads.
282   */
283  public final DefaultLoader<T> with(final Provider provider) {
284    return new DefaultLoader<>(this, provider == null ? List.of() : List.of(provider));
285  }
286
287  /**
288   * Returns a {@link DefaultLoader} that {@linkplain #providers()
289   * uses} only the supplied {@link Provider}s.
290   *
291   * @param providers the {@link Provider}s; may be {@code null} or
292   * {@linkplain Collection#isEmpty() empty} in which case {@link
293   * Provider}s will be loaded using the {@link ServiceLoader} class
294   *
295   * @return a {@link DefaultLoader} that {@linkplain #providers()
296   * uses} only the supplied {@link Provider}s
297   *
298   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
299   *
300   * @idempotency This method is not idempotent (it usually creates a
301   * new {@link DefaultLoader} to return) but is deterministic.
302   *
303   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
304   * threads.
305   */
306  public final DefaultLoader<T> with(final Collection<? extends Provider> providers) {
307    return new DefaultLoader<>(this, providers);
308  }
309
310  /**
311   * Returns a {@link DefaultLoader} that {@linkplain
312   * #ambiguityHandler() uses the supplied
313   * <code>AmbiguityHandler</code>}.
314   *
315   * @param ambiguityHandler the {@link AmbiguityHandler}; must not be
316   * {@code null}
317   *
318   * @return a {@link DefaultLoader} that {@linkplain
319   * #ambiguityHandler() uses the supplied
320   * <code>AmbiguityHandler</code>}
321   *
322   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code ambiguityHandler} is
323   * {@code null}
324   *
325   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
326   *
327   * @idempotency This method is not idempotent (it usually creates a
328   * new {@link DefaultLoader} to return) but is deterministic.
329   *
330   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
331   * threads.
332   */
333  public final DefaultLoader<T> with(final AmbiguityHandler ambiguityHandler) {
334    if (ambiguityHandler == this.ambiguityHandler()) {
335      return this;
336    } else {
337      return new DefaultLoader<>(this, ambiguityHandler);
338    }
339  }
340
341  /**
342   * Returns an {@linkplain
343   * java.util.Collections#unmodifiableCollection(Collection)
344   * unmodifiable} {@link Collection} of {@link Provider}s that this
345   * {@link DefaultLoader} will use to supply objects.
346   *
347   * <p>This method never returns {@code null}.</p>
348   *
349   * @return an {@linkplain
350   * java.util.Collections#unmodifiableCollection(Collection)
351   * unmodifiable} {@link Collection} of {@link Provider}s that this
352   * {@link DefaultLoader} will use to supply objects; never {@code null}
353   *
354   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
355   *
356   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
357   * threads.
358   *
359   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
360   */
361  public final Collection<Provider> providers() {
362    return this.providers;
363  }
364
365  /**
366   * Returns the {@link AmbiguityHandler} associated with this {@link
367   * DefaultLoader}.
368   *
369   * <p>This method never returns {@code null}.</p>
370   *
371   * @return the {@link AmbiguityHandler} associated with this {@link
372   * DefaultLoader}; never {@code null}
373   *
374   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}
375   *
376   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
377   * threads.
378   *
379   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
380   *
381   * @see AmbiguityHandler
382   */
383  public final AmbiguityHandler ambiguityHandler() {
384    // NOTE: This null check is critical.  We check for null here
385    // because during bootstrapping the AmbiguityHandler will not have
386    // been loaded yet, and yet the bootstrapping mechanism may still
387    // end up calling this.ambiguityHandler().  The alternative would
388    // be to make the ambiguityHandler field non-final and I don't
389    // want to do that.
390    final AmbiguityHandler ambiguityHandler = this.ambiguityHandler;
391    return ambiguityHandler == null ? NoOpAmbiguityHandler.INSTANCE : ambiguityHandler;
392  }
393
394  /**
395   * Returns the {@link DefaultLoader} serving as the parent of this
396   * {@link DefaultLoader}.
397   *
398   * <p>The "root" {@link DefaultLoader} returns itself from its
399   * {@link #parent()} implementation.</p>
400   *
401   * <p>This method never returns {@code null}.</p>
402   *
403   * @return the non-{@code null} {@link DefaultLoader} serving as the
404   * parent of this {@link DefaultLoader}; may be this {@link
405   * DefaultLoader} itself
406   *
407   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
408   *
409   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
410   * threads.
411   *
412   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
413   */
414  // Note that the root will have itself as its parent.
415  @Override // Loader<T>
416  public final DefaultLoader<?> parent() {
417    return this.parent;
418  }
419
420  /**
421   * Returns the {@linkplain Path#absolute() absolute} {@link Path}
422   * with which this {@link DefaultLoader} is associated.
423   *
424   * <p>This method never returns {@code null}.</p>
425   *
426   * @return the non-{@code null} {@linkplain Path#absolute()
427   * absolute} {@link Path} with which this {@link DefaultLoader} is
428   * associated
429   *
430   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
431   *
432   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
433   * threads.
434   *
435   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
436   */
437  @Override // Loader<T>
438  public final Path<? extends Type> path() {
439    return this.absolutePath;
440  }
441
442  /**
443   * Returns a {@link Determinism} suitable for this {@link
444   * DefaultLoader}.
445   *
446   * @return a {@link Determinism} suitable for this {@link
447   * DefaultLoader}
448   *
449   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
450   *
451   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
452   *
453   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
454   * threads.
455   */
456  public final Determinism determinism() {
457    final OptionalSupplier<?> s = this.supplier;
458    return s == null ? Determinism.NON_DETERMINISTIC : s.determinism();
459  }
460
461  @Override // Loader<T>
462  public final T get() {
463    return this.supplier.get();
464  }
465
466  @Override // Loader<T>
467  public final DefaultLoader<?> loaderFor(Path<? extends Type> path) {
468    return (DefaultLoader<?>)Loader.super.loaderFor(path);
469  }
470
471  /**
472   * Returns a {@link DefaultLoader} that can {@linkplain #get()
473   * supply} environmental objects that are suitable for the supplied
474   * {@code path}.
475   *
476   * <p>This method never returns {@code null}.</p>
477   *
478   * <p>The {@link DefaultLoader} that is returned may return {@code
479   * null} from its {@link Loader#get() get()} method.  Additionally,
480   * the {@link DefaultLoader} that is returned may throw {@link
481   * java.util.NoSuchElementException} or {@link
482   * UnsupportedOperationException} from its {@link #get() get()}
483   * method.</p>
484   *
485   * @param <U> the type of the supplied {@link Path} and the type of
486   * the returned {@link DefaultLoader}
487   *
488   * @param path the {@link Path} for which a {@link DefaultLoader}
489   * should be returned; must not be {@code null}
490   *
491   * @return a {@link DefaultLoader} capable of {@linkplain #get()
492   * supplying} environmental objects suitable for the supplied {@code
493   * path}; never {@code null}
494   *
495   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code path} is {@code null}
496   *
497   * @exception IllegalArgumentException if the {@code path}, after
498   * {@linkplain #normalize(Path) normalization}, {@linkplain
499   * Path#isRoot() is the root <code>Path</code>}
500   *
501   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
502   *
503   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
504   * threads.
505   *
506   * @threadsafety This method is idempotent and deterministic.
507   */
508  @Override // Loader<T>
509  public final <U> DefaultLoader<U> load(final Path<? extends Type> path) {
510    final Path<? extends Type> absolutePath = this.normalize(path);
511    if (!absolutePath.absolute()) {
512      throw new IllegalArgumentException("!normalize(path).absolute(): " + absolutePath);
513    } else if (absolutePath.isRoot()) {
514      throw new IllegalArgumentException("normalize(path).isRoot(): " + absolutePath);
515    }
516    final DefaultLoader<?> requestor = this.loaderFor(absolutePath);
517    // We deliberately do not use computeIfAbsent() because load()
518    // operations can kick off other load() operations, and then you'd
519    // have a cache mutating operation occuring within a cache
520    // mutating operation, which is forbidden.  Sometimes you get an
521    // IllegalStateException as you are supposed to; other times you
522    // do not, which is a JDK bug.  See
523    // https://blog.jooq.org/avoid-recursion-in-concurrenthashmap-computeifabsent/.
524    //
525    // This obviously can result in unnecessary work, but most
526    // configuration use cases will cause this work to happen anyway.
527    DefaultLoader<?> defaultLoader = this.loaderCache.get(absolutePath);
528    if (defaultLoader == null) {
529      defaultLoader = this.loaderCache.putIfAbsent(absolutePath, this.computeLoader(requestor, absolutePath));
530      if (defaultLoader == null) {
531        defaultLoader = this.loaderCache.get(absolutePath);
532      }
533    }
534    @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
535    final DefaultLoader<U> returnValue = (DefaultLoader<U>)defaultLoader;
536    return returnValue;
537  }
538
539  @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
540  private final <U> DefaultLoader<U> computeLoader(final DefaultLoader<?> requestor, final Path<? extends Type> absolutePath) {
541    final Qualifiers<? extends String, ?> qualifiers = absolutePath.qualifiers();
542    final AmbiguityHandler ambiguityHandler = requestor.ambiguityHandler();
543    Value<U> candidate = null;
544    final Collection<? extends Provider> providers = this.providers();
545    if (!providers.isEmpty()) {
546      final Map<Path<? extends Type>, Deque<Provider>> map = currentProviderStacks.get();
547
548      Provider candidateProvider = null;
549      int candidateQualifiersScore = Integer.MIN_VALUE;
550      int candidatePathScore = Integer.MIN_VALUE;
551
552      for (final Provider provider : providers) {
553
554        if (provider == null) {
555          ambiguityHandler.providerRejected(requestor, absolutePath, provider);
556          continue;
557        }
558
559        if (provider == peek(map, absolutePath)) {
560          // Behave the same as the null case immediately prior, but
561          // there's no need to notify the ambiguityHandler.
562          continue;
563        }
564
565        if (!isSelectable(provider, absolutePath)) {
566          ambiguityHandler.providerRejected(requestor, absolutePath, provider);
567          continue;
568        }
569
570        Value<U> value;
571
572        push(map, absolutePath, provider);
573        try {
574          value = (Value<U>)provider.get(requestor, absolutePath);
575        } finally {
576          pop(map, absolutePath);
577        }
578
579        if (value == null) {
580          ambiguityHandler.providerRejected(requestor, absolutePath, provider);
581          continue;
582        }
583
584        // NOTE: INFINITE LOOP POSSIBILITY; read carefully!
585        while (true) {
586
587          value = value.with(requestor.transliterate(value.path()));
588
589          if (!isSelectable(absolutePath, value.path())) {
590            ambiguityHandler.valueRejected(requestor, absolutePath, provider, value);
591            break;
592          }
593
594          if (candidate == null) {
595            candidate = value;
596            candidateProvider = provider;
597            candidateQualifiersScore = ambiguityHandler.score(qualifiers, candidate.qualifiers());
598            candidatePathScore = ambiguityHandler.score(absolutePath, candidate.path());
599            break;
600          }
601
602          // Let's score Qualifiers first, not paths.  This is an
603          // arbitrary decision, but one grounded in reality: most
604          // often qualifiers are both empty and so this is very
605          // quick, and when they are not empty, in real-world
606          // situations they're normally completely disjoint.  Get all
607          // this out of the way early.
608          //
609          // We score qualifiers in a method devoted to them rather
610          // than just folding the qualifier scoring into the path
611          // scoring method because the scoring systems may produce
612          // wildly different numbers, and if the path- and
613          // qualifier-scoring systems use, for example, size() in
614          // their algorithms, you don't want a huge pile of
615          // qualifiers accidentally affecting a path score.
616          final int valueQualifiersScore = ambiguityHandler.score(qualifiers, value.qualifiers());
617          if (valueQualifiersScore < candidateQualifiersScore) {
618            candidate = new Value<>(candidate, value);
619            break;
620          }
621
622          if (valueQualifiersScore > candidateQualifiersScore) {
623            candidate = new Value<>(value, candidate);
624            candidateProvider = provider;
625            candidateQualifiersScore = valueQualifiersScore;
626            // (No need to update candidatePathScore.)
627            break;
628          }
629
630          // The Qualifiers scores were equal (extremely common).
631          // Let's do paths.
632          final int valuePathScore = ambiguityHandler.score(absolutePath, value.path());
633
634          if (valuePathScore < candidatePathScore) {
635            candidate = new Value<>(candidate, value);
636            break;
637          }
638
639          if (valuePathScore > candidatePathScore) {
640            candidate = new Value<>(value, candidate);
641            candidateProvider = provider;
642            candidateQualifiersScore = valueQualifiersScore;
643            candidatePathScore = valuePathScore;
644            break;
645          }
646
647          final Value<U> disambiguatedValue =
648            ambiguityHandler.disambiguate(requestor, absolutePath, candidateProvider, candidate, provider, value);
649
650          if (disambiguatedValue == null) {
651            // Couldn't disambiguate.  Drop both values.
652            break;
653          }
654
655          if (disambiguatedValue.equals(candidate)) {
656            candidate = new Value<>(candidate, value);
657            break;
658          }
659
660          if (disambiguatedValue.equals(value)) {
661            candidate = new Value<>(disambiguatedValue, candidate);
662            candidateProvider = provider;
663            candidateQualifiersScore = valueQualifiersScore;
664            candidatePathScore = valuePathScore;
665            break;
666          }
667
668          // Disambiguation came up with an entirely different value,
669          // so run it back through the while loop.
670          value = disambiguatedValue;
671
672        }
673      }
674    }
675    return
676      new DefaultLoader<>(this.loaderCache,
677                          providers,
678                          requestor, // parent
679                          absolutePath,
680                          candidate == null ? Absence.instance() : candidate,
681                          ambiguityHandler);
682  }
683
684
685  /*
686   * Static methods.
687   */
688
689
690  private static final <T> Collection<T> add(final Collection<? extends T> c, final T e) {
691    if (c == null || c.isEmpty()) {
692      return e == null ? List.of() : List.of(e);
693    } else if (e == null) {
694      return Collections.unmodifiableCollection(c);
695    } else {
696      final Collection<T> newC = new ArrayList<>(c.size() + 1);
697      newC.addAll(c);
698      newC.add(e);
699      return Collections.unmodifiableCollection(newC);
700    }
701  }
702
703  private static final <T> Collection<T> add(final Collection<? extends T> c, final Collection<? extends T> c2) {
704    if (c == null || c.isEmpty()) {
705      if (c2 == null || c2.isEmpty()) {
706        return List.of();
707      } else {
708        return Collections.unmodifiableCollection(c2);
709      }
710    } else if (c2 == null || c2.isEmpty()) {
711      return Collections.unmodifiableCollection(c);
712    } else {
713      final Collection<T> newC = new ArrayList<>(c.size() + c2.size());
714      newC.addAll(c);
715      newC.addAll(c2);
716      return Collections.unmodifiableCollection(newC);
717    }
718  }
719
720  private static final Provider peek(final Map<?, ? extends Deque<Provider>> map,
721                                     final Path<? extends Type> absolutePath) {
722    final Queue<? extends Provider> q = map.get(absolutePath);
723    return q == null ? null : q.peek();
724  }
725
726  private static final void push(final Map<Path<? extends Type>, Deque<Provider>> map,
727                                 final Path<? extends Type> absolutePath,
728                                 final Provider provider) {
729    map.computeIfAbsent(absolutePath, ap -> new ArrayDeque<>(5)).push(provider);
730  }
731
732  private static final Provider pop(final Map<?, ? extends Deque<Provider>> map,
733                                    final Path<? extends Type> absolutePath) {
734    final Deque<? extends Provider> dq = map.get(absolutePath);
735    return dq == null ? null : dq.pop();
736  }
737
738  private static final boolean isSelectable(final Provider provider, final Path<? extends Type> absolutePath) {
739    final Type providerLowerBound = provider.lowerBound();
740    return providerLowerBound == null || JavaTypes.assignable(absolutePath.qualified(), providerLowerBound);
741  }
742
743  static final Collection<Provider> loadedProviders() {
744    return Loaded.providers;
745  }
746
747  private static final AmbiguityHandler loadedAmbiguityHandler() {
748    return Loaded.ambiguityHandler;
749  }
750
751  /**
752   * Returns {@code true} if the supplied {@code valuePath} is
753   * <em>selectable</em> (for further consideration and scoring) with
754   * respect to the supplied {@code absoluteReferencePath}.
755   *
756   * <p>This method calls {@link Path#endsWith(Path, BiPredicate)} on
757   * the supplied {@code absoluteReferencePath} with {@code valuePath}
758   * as its {@link Path}-typed first argument, and a {@link
759   * BiPredicate} that returns {@code true} if and only if all of the
760   * following conditions are true:</p>
761   *
762   * <ul>
763   *
764   * <li>Each {@link Element} has a {@linkplain Element#name()
765   * name} that is either {@linkplain String#isEmpty() empty} or equal
766   * to the other's.</li>
767   *
768   * <li>Either {@link Element} has a {@link Element#type() Type}
769   * that is {@code null}, or the first {@link Element}'s {@link
770   * Element#type() Type} {@link AssignableType#of(Type) is
771   * assignable from} the second's.</li>
772   *
773   * <li>Either {@link Element} has {@code null} {@linkplain
774   * Element#parameters() parameters} or each of the first {@link
775   * Element}'s {@linkplain Element#parameters() parameters}
776   * {@linkplain Class#isAssignableFrom(Class) is assignable from} the
777   * second's corresponding parameter.</li>
778   *
779   * </ul>
780   *
781   * <p>In all other cases this method returns {@code false} or throws
782   * an exception.</p>
783   *
784   * @param absoluteReferencePath the reference path; must not be
785   * {@code null}; must be {@linkplain Path#absolute() absolute}
786   *
787   * @param valuePath the {@link Path} to test; must not be {@code
788   * null}
789   *
790   * @return {@code true} if {@code valuePath} is selectable (for
791   * further consideration and scoring) with respect to {@code
792   * absoluteReferencePath}; {@code false} in all other cases
793   *
794   * @exception NullPointerException if either parameter is {@code
795   * null}
796   *
797   * @exception IllegalArgumentException if {@code
798   * absoluteReferencePath} {@linkplain Path#absolute() is not
799   * absolute}
800   */
801  private static final boolean isSelectable(final Path<? extends Type> absoluteReferencePath, final Path<? extends Type> valuePath) {
802    if (!absoluteReferencePath.absolute()) {
803      throw new IllegalArgumentException("absoluteReferencePath: " + absoluteReferencePath);
804    }
805    final Qualifiers<?, ?> q1 = absoluteReferencePath.qualifiers();
806    // Remember that a Path's Qualifiers include the Qualifiers of
807    // every Path.Element in the Path.
808    if (q1 != null && !q1.isEmpty()) {
809      final Qualifiers<?, ?> q2 = valuePath.qualifiers();
810      if (q2 != null && !q2.isEmpty() && q1.intersectionSize(q2) <= 0) {
811        return false;
812      }
813    }
814    return absoluteReferencePath.endsWith(valuePath, NamesAndTypesAreCompatibleBiPredicate.INSTANCE);
815  }
816
817  private static final <T> T throwNoSuchElementException() {
818    throw new NoSuchElementException();
819  }
820
821
822  /*
823   * Inner and nested classes.
824   */
825
826
827  private static final class Loaded {
828
829    private static final List<Provider> providers =
830      ServiceLoader.load(Provider.class, Provider.class.getClassLoader())
831      .stream()
832      .map(ServiceLoader.Provider::get)
833      .toList();
834
835    private static final AmbiguityHandler ambiguityHandler =
836      ServiceLoader.load(AmbiguityHandler.class, AmbiguityHandler.class.getClassLoader())
837      .stream()
838      .map(ServiceLoader.Provider::get)
839      .findFirst()
840      .orElse(NoOpAmbiguityHandler.INSTANCE);
841
842  }
843
844  private static final class NoOpAmbiguityHandler implements AmbiguityHandler {
845
846    private static final NoOpAmbiguityHandler INSTANCE = new NoOpAmbiguityHandler();
847
848    private NoOpAmbiguityHandler() {
849      super();
850    }
851
852  }
853
854  private static final class NamesAndTypesAreCompatibleBiPredicate implements BiPredicate<Element<?>, Element<?>> {
855
856    private static final NamesAndTypesAreCompatibleBiPredicate INSTANCE = new NamesAndTypesAreCompatibleBiPredicate();
857
858    private NamesAndTypesAreCompatibleBiPredicate() {
859      super();
860    }
861
862    @Override // BiPredicate<Element<?>, Element<?>>
863    public final boolean test(final Element<?> e1, final Element<?> e2) {
864      final String name1 = e1.name();
865      if (!name1.isEmpty()) {
866        final String name2 = e2.name();
867        if (!name2.isEmpty() && !name1.equals(name2)) {
868          // Empty names have special significance in that they
869          // "match" any other name.
870          return false;
871        }
872      }
873
874      final Object o1 = e1.qualified();
875      if (o1 == null) {
876        return e2.qualified() == null;
877      } else if (!(o1 instanceof Type) ||
878                 !(e2.qualified() instanceof Type t2) ||
879                 !JavaTypes.assignable((Type)o1, t2)) {
880        return false;
881      }
882
883      return true;
884    }
885
886  }
887
888}
